page.title: 02CLUBS-BELMONT,SURREY
page.content: St. John's church provides an active youth centre in the village.Young people enjoy Scouts,Cubs,Brownies, Guides,Crusaders and the youth club. There are two small parks in the village where children can enjoy themselves.Belmont park is between the station and Shanklin Village. The other is beside St. John's church in Northdown Road. Adults can attend the Conservative or British Legion or indoor bowls clubs. A local tennis club in Holland Avenue is popular with young and old alike. Some villagers work at the Royal Marsden hospital and are entitled to use and enjoy its sports facilities, which include a swimming pool. Beautiful Banstead Downs are nearby providing an ideal spot for picnics,horse riding and golf.
